title: travelplanner: Can you help craft a 5-day travel plan that starts in Colorado Springs and takes in 2 cities in Illinois from March 5th to March 9th, 2022? Single traveler with an overall budget of $1,900. (2199b94d2979a73e)

always_included_messages.content: Based on the user's query, make the best travel plan for the user and save it. Do not ask follow-up questions.

chat_history.content: Can you help craft a 5-day travel plan that starts in Colorado Springs and takes in 2 cities in Illinois from March 5th to March 9th, 2022? Single traveler with an overall budget of $1,900.

# Rocky Mountain Road Trip

## Day 1: Colorado Springs
- Morning: Start your day at the Garden of the Gods. Explore this unique geological park with its stunning red sandstone formations, offering a perfect backdrop for hiking and rock climbing.
- Lunch: Head to the historic downtown and enjoy a meal at a local restaurant like the Rabbit Hole Diner for some traditional American cuisine.
- Afternoon: Visit the Colorado Springs Fine Arts Center at Colorado College, a great spot to appreciate art and architecture.
- Evening: End the day with a scenic walk around the Cheyenne Lake.

## Day 2: Travel to Chicago, Illinois
- Take an early morning flight from Colorado Springs Airport (COS) to Chicago (ORD). This should cost around $300-400 for a one-way ticket.
- Upon arrival in Chicago, head to your accommodation and freshen up.
- Dinner: Experience Chicago's famous deep-dish pizza at a renowned spot like Giordano's or Lou Malnati's.

## Day 3: Exploring Chicago
- Morning: Visit Millennium Park and take in iconic structures like the Cloud Gate (aka The Bean) and the Crown Fountain.
- Lunch: Try some classic Chicago-style hotdogs at Portillo's.
- Afternoon: Head to the Art Institute of Chicago, one of the oldest and largest art museums in the U.S.
- Evening: Enjoy a show at The Second City, known for its rich history in improv comedy.

## Day 4: Chicago to Springfield
- Pick up a rental car and drive southwest towards Springfield, Illinois (approximately 3-3.5 hours drive).
- Lunch: Stop at a local diner or cafe along the way.
- Upon arrival in Springfield, visit the Abraham Lincoln Presidential Library and Museum to learn about the life and legacy of the 16th U.S. President.
- Dinner: Try the local cuisine at the iconic Cozy Dog Drive In, famous for its corn dogs.

## Day 5: Springfield and Return to Colorado Springs
- Morning: Visit the Illinois State Capitol and take a guided tour of the building.
- Lunch: Enjoy a meal at a local brewery like the Obed & Isaac's Microbrewery & Eatery.
- Return your rental car and catch a flight back to Colorado Springs from Springfield's Abraham Lincoln Capital Airport (SPI). Flight prices can vary, but you can expect to pay around $500-600 for a one-way ticket.

## Estimated Budget:
- Flights: $800 - $1000
- Accommodation (3 nights): $500 - $700 (depending on preferences)
- Food and Activities: $400 - $500
- Transportation (including car rental): $300 - $400

Total Estimated Cost: $2000 - $2600

*Note: This travel plan provides a rough estimate of costs and does not include all expenses. The actual costs may vary depending on specific choices of accommodation, dining, and activities.*

Have a fantastic trip!

functions.name: delegate
functions.desc:
Ask a capable helper for help looking up a piece of information or performing an action.
Do not simply repeat what the user said as instructions.
You should use this to break up complex user queries into multiple simpler steps.
NOTE: Helpers cannot see previous parts of your conversation.

instructions.description: Detailed instructions on what your helper should do to help you.

functions.name: submit_day_plan
functions.desc:
Once you have collected information about the trip, call this function once for each day of the trip, starting on day 1.
If a field does not apply for a given day, use "-" to indicate this.
You MUST call this function to save the plan for each query.

current_city.description: The city for this day. If the plan is to travel between two cities, indicate it as "from A to B" (e.g. "from Ithaca to Charlotte").

transportation.description: e.g. "Flight Number: F3633413, from Ithaca to Charlotte, Departure Time: 05:38, Arrival Time: 07:46"

breakfast.description: The name of a restaurant in the city, e.g. "Nagaland's Kitchen, Charlotte"

attraction.description: Use a ";" to separate different attractions, with each attraction formatted as "Name, City". e.g. "The Charlotte Museum of History, Charlotte;"

accommodation.description: e.g. "Affordable Spacious Refurbished Room in Bushwick!, Charlotte"
